comments.body: Is setuptools actually a run req?
@msarahan there are `pkg_resources` imports all over the code. So I guess it is...

Yes, (somewhat unfortunately) it is required at runtime.

Sent from my iPhone

> On Sep 4, 2016, at 6:18 PM, Filipe notifications@github.com wrote:
> 
> In recipes/mdtraj/meta.yaml:
> 
> > -  number: 0
> > -  script: python setup.py install --single-version-externally-managed --record record.txt
> > -  entry_points:
> > -    - mdconvert = mdtraj.scripts.mdconvert:entry_point
> > -    - mdinspect = mdtraj.scripts.mdinspect:entry_point
> >   +
> >   +requirements:
> > -  build:
> > -    - python
> > -    - setuptools
> > -    - cython
> > -    - numpy x.x
> >   +
> > -  run:
> > -    - python
> > -    - setuptools
> >   @msarahan there are pkg_resources imports all over the code. So I guess it is...
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub, or mute the thread.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +28,32 @@  run:
    - python
    - setuptools
    - numpy x.x
    - scipy
